Title: Civil Love

reviewText: Alas!  It pains me to say it, as I support the decent and wholesome film industry.  But so often they do fall short.  And this one falls short.  The story line in and of itself, is promising.  A young Yankee widow finds a wounded Confederate soldier in her barn.  The Confederate being an escaped prisoner of war and they eventually fall-in-love.  The main drawback of the film is that they make the mistake of simply taking modern people and putting them in old timey clothing and thinking that is sufficient.  The dialogue is decidedly modern and not at all historical in nature, such as greeting each other with "Hi!".  The young girl actor who wear pants throughout the film has very modern looking hair.  And nobody felt "old timey" in their acting.  It doesn't work to just put on different clothes and think that is enough.  There is a certain getting into the feel of the historical time period being represented that is called for in a good historical film and it is that element of quality that is lacking in this movie.  I'm not disappointed I saw the film, but I wouldn't buy it again knowing now what it is like.
Title: Civil Love

reviewText: I have watched this movie several times and never get tired of it.It is educational as well as a terrific love story.
Title: Civil Love

reviewText: I like good clean movies (or as clean as you can get nowadays). Civil Love was really, really clean, except for two scenes.  In the first, a man is shot and we see a very bloody wound.  In the second, he has to cut out the bullet, but you don't see a close up.  They cut the picture above the would so you only see some blood on his hands and shirt and you can tell he is in pain.  Two men intend to shoot a man to keep him silent about a situation.  In an exchange of fire one of them is killed and the other man runs off; a man is wounded with a gunshot to the shoulder and two other men intend to rob a woman, but are stopped.Most say the acting is amateurish and the storyline predictable.  That may be true, but other than the bloody scene (which I have to admit was not necessary to show), this movie was clean and had high morals and taught a good message.  The Dove Foundation gave it a five star and approved it for ages 12 and older.  Because it is a movie that takes place during the Civil War, talk of loss and men hunting another is expected.  It is probably the cleanest Civil War movie ever made, however, because of the two scenes with blood and the fact that a soldier is being hunted I wouldn't recommend it for children.  It is still move of an adult show.It starts with Daniel (a confederate soldier) fleeing from two men who shot him (this is where the wound is shown).  He hides in a barn, removes the bullet and passes out.  Rachel, the widow who own the farm, has two children.  While doing their chores they find him and the mother bandages his wound, leaves him food, but ties him up just to be safe.  She is afraid because her husband was killed by confederate soldiers in the war.  Daniel ends up saving her and the children from robbers and as they all learn to trust and care for each other, they become a makeshift family.  However, Rachel's brother-in-law and town sheriff, doesn't like the idea.  Rachel makes him promise not to arrest him or tell anyone about him, but he eventually finds it too much when Rachel's turns down his marriage proposal and she admits to caring for Daniel, so he tells the two men hunting Daniel where he is.  Rachel finds out and after telling her brother-in-law who the two men really are, they both go try and save Daniel and to arrest the two men.  As in most of these kinds of movies, all ends happily.Overall, I liked this move and would watch it again.
summary: Civil Love - I would watch it again

Title: Civil Love

reviewText: This story provides an interesting premise for a love story, and for the most part, it delivers.The set-up is not totally unfamiliar: a single mom with children, isolated, trying to make a go of it in a primitive enviroment.  Along comes a handsome(once he shaves) mysterious stranger in need.  The added relish, it's the Civil War; he's of the enemy that killed her husband, and he's recently escaped from a brutal prison.It's a great plot for interesting interactions, and an ever present feeling of danger looms overhead, makes it all the more romantic.  Can he be trusted?  Will the authorities catch up to him and kill him?  Can the heroine resist the growing feelings she's developing?In general, the filming, sets, and acting are fine. It's a tad low budget, and in places, it comes across like TV show and the costumes a bit stagey looking.  The outdoor shots with the cold were much better, and the music flows fine with the scenes, which can be problem with lower budgets.  We really liked the hero; his acting appeared more natural and real with less words and more expressiveness.It garnered 5 Doves out of 5 for family approved.  There's a small amount of blood shown, and scenes of threatening and endangerment, but overall, most school kids can watch this.
Title: Civil Love

reviewText: I really liked this movie. I rented it, & wouldn't mind owning it. About the bad reviews...yep, they could have been in appropriate costumes. How hard would it have been to throw him in a rebel soldier outfit & the marshal in a union one? Plus the daughter & the pants??? No women wore pants in that time period...tomboy or not. I also think the marshal could have been a little meaner and more believable--seems like that would have been an easy enough part to play. That particular actor played a mean, hateful man in Belle & the Beast which was much more believable...so not sure what the deal is with this similar part. So, I get the complaints...but oh, my goodness...it totally doesn't warrant overlooking this movie! I knew before I watched it, that they would end up together...I didn't watch it to be surprised! Yet, the story was not boring. The characters drew me in. I could just imagine the hatred she felt, then  the hesitance of letting her guard down, and the sense of betrayal to her husband, her family, and her country by having feelings for the enemy! I think the actors played the parts well...there was the staunchness that you would expect from a person in her circumstance, and the honor, integrity, and Job -like patience of the man which won her over. I will watch it again! Love it. Clean, no bad language, and great story.
summary: Take a Chance & don't listen to the bad reviews!
Title: Civil Love

Title: Civil Love

reviewerName: Penny Zeller, Christian Author and Speaker
reviewText: Once in awhile you come across a love story to be added to your list of favorites. For me, "Civil Love" is one of those movies.Rachel and her two children must find a way to survive on their own after the death of Rachel's husband a year earlier. A soldier for the Union Army during the Civil War, Rachel's husband was killed by enemy soldiers. When faced with a proposition to remarry the local sheriff, will Rachel do so, even if it means being married to someone she doesn't love? And what will she do about the stranger she found injured in her barn? After all, the stranger is a Confederate soldier - just like the ones who killed her husband.Daniel recently escaped from a Union Army prison. A Confederate soldier from Georgia, Daniel is shot in his attempt to return home. Will he survive the brutal cold? Will he be able to outrun the two men relentlessly searching for him? What happens when he collapses in a barn, only to discover later it is the barn of a woman who has lost her Union Army husband at the hands of Daniel's fellow soldiers? Will she turn him in to the sheriff?"Civil Love" is not only a love story, but it's also an action story, which makes it perfect for a husband/wife movie night. The characters are real-to-life and the plot is engaging.  Family unity, loyalty, love, honesty, and not judging others are the themes showcased in this movie."Civil Love" contains nothing offensive and I would highly recommend it for those ages nine and over due to a scene showing Daniel's wound, a scary scene of a burglary, and a shoot-out which might frighten very young children.I have placed this movie in my library of favorite movies  - thank you SunWorld Pictures for creating enjoyable and wholesome family entertainment!"Civil Love" has been added to my list of Mom-Approved Movies on my Wordpress blog.
summary: Add this to your list of favorites!
Title: Civil Love

reviewText: I like old civil war stories and watching how people handled adversity back then. I think anyone who likes love stories would like this movie.
Title: Civil Love

reviewText: OMGoodness! Le me preface this by saying that I've studied scripts and directed, acted, etc in theater. Now... script has some promise but that's it. Whoever directed this needs to find another job to do in life. The actress tries way too hard. The lead actress can NOT.. repeat: NOT act.  In fact, she went the distance to wreck the movie. The guy who played her brother in law has potential as an actor and maybe if he had a better director, he would have done better. The kids were okay. Too bad they didn't have more script to work with. The bad guys... now one of those two was really good. The goofy guy. His "leader" was okay. I wish they could have done more with this script. It is not a fully flushed out script or movie. I hate giving bad reviews. There is no depth to this movie. No brilliance. No real growth. The movie will not stay in my mind nor do I have any interest in buying a copy of it. That's too bad because I really wanted the opportunity for that but seeing the movie wiped that interest right away.
Title: Civil Love
